content:
I'm happy to help! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have the capability to set alarms or reminders on your device. But I can guide you through the process of setting a daily alarm on your phone or device.

Here's how you can set a daily alarm for 7:30 am on weekdays:

**For Android devices:**

1. Open the Clock app on your Android device.
2. Tap the "+" icon in the top-right corner to create a new alarm.
3. Set the alarm time to 7:30 am.
4. Tap "Repeat" and select "Monday" to "Friday" to set the alarm for weekdays only.
5. Choose a ringtone and set the alarm label (e.g., "Wake up for work").
6. Tap "Save" to save the alarm.

**For iOS devices:**

1. Open the Clock app on your iPhone or iPad.
2. Tap the "+" icon in the top-right corner to create a new alarm.
3. Set the alarm time to 7:30 am.
4. Tap "Repeat" and select "Monday" to "Friday" to set the alarm for weekdays only.
5. Choose a sound and set the alarm label (e.g., "Wake up for work").
6. Tap "Save" to save the alarm.

**For other devices:**

If you're using a different device or operating system, you can follow similar steps to set a daily alarm. You can also use a third-party alarm clock app or a virtual assistant like Google Assistant or Siri to set reminders and alarms.

Remember to adjust the alarm time and settings according to your preferences and needs.
